p.s: The novel The Great Gatsby written by F. Scott Fitzgerald and published in 1925 narrates the exemplary story of Jay Gatsby, a young American millionaire whose ambitious pursuit of the American promise of wealth, prosperity and happiness results in his fall.
Given excerpt from chapter five of the novel plays aproximatelyapproximately in the middle of it, taking place after Nick meeting Gatsby and finding about his past with Daisy, Nick's cousin.
They have been in love for five years, however Daisy has married Tom Buchanan instead of waiting for Gatsby to come back.
After hearing the truth from Jordan Baker, a friend of Daisy's, Nick arranges for the meeting of Daisy Buchanan and Jay Gatsby which is narrated in the excerpt at hand.
Nick receives Daisy in front of his house where they shortly greet each other and go inside.
Nick has invited her over for tea a few days ago.
The living room is empty but then Gatsby knocks on the door and Nick lets him in, staying in the hall while Gatsby goes to the living room where Daisy greets him.
Nick follows Gatsby shortly after and listens as Gatsby and Daisy recall when the last time they have met has been.
After exchanging a few words with Daisy, Nick wants to leave and is stopped by Gatsby who tells him that inviting Daisy is a mistake in the kitchen.
This leads to Nick ordering him to join Daisy impatiently whilst he himself goes outside and watches Gatsby's mansion.
When he goes back inside, Daisy is teary and Gatsby's mood is better.
He tells Nick and Daisy to go with him to see his house.
